publicationStmt.publisher: The Characters that shaped the Silk Road - A Database and Digital Paleography of Tarim

msIdentifier.repository: Bibliothèque nationale de France, fonds Pelliot Koutchéen (Paris)

seg.seg: Great king, so it will be!
Great king, so it will be! (Georges-Jean Pinault, p.c.)
Wenn du den Rāhula ... geschmückt hast, bringe ihn schnell herbei!
If you have adorned Rāhula, .... bring him here quickly!

list.item:
I have entered a very preliminary transliteration based on the transcription and the photograph in order to test the XML conversion scripts. It should be revised while marking up the akṣaras in Transkribus. (BK)

Alternative classifications:
Peyrotarchaic I
Malzahncommon archaic
Tamai–
Tamai-C14–

Translations from [[Peyrot, ToSu]]
Lines Translation Pages
a1 Great king, so it will be! (Georges-Jean Pinault, p.c.) 297


Translations from [[Schmidt KT 1974]]
Lines Translation Pages
a2 Wenn du den Rāhula ... geschmückt hast, bringe ihn schnell herbei! 392


please do not cite without asking Michaël Peyrot or Georges-Jean Pinault


  • "<sup>1a</sup>" etc. changed to "#1a" etc., "¦" changed to ";". Word wrap fixed. –Martin (Fri, 2014-10-17, 10:36:03)
  • What does a2, a4 etc. "~" mean!? –Martin (Fri, 2014-10-17, 10:36:03)
  • What did b5 "m̱a̱pi" mean!? Taken as "_m_api" and therefore changed to "mäpi". –Martin (Fri, 2014-10-17, 10:41:55)

"~" changed to "•". Presumably this was meant? "~" to indicate a "•" that is stretched or dragged on to the next akṣara?? (cf. lines a2, a3) - BK, TI


additional classification A1

a1 /// ·p· ·s· kl(aut)s(ai)n(e) pästänn(e) • am(ā)c weṣṣä(ṃ) • o(roc)cu w(a)lo mant|mä(ṃ)t tākaṃ_(Sg.)|tāk(aṃ) /// a2 – – wakitsäññe rāhuleṃ yaitormeṃ ramer|rämer ecce pkalar-ne|pkälar-ne • plaktukäñña|plaktukiñña weṣṣäṃ • mant|mänt tākaṃ_(Sg.)|tākaṃ – /// a3 – ñake|ñäke mñcuṣke|mcuṣke • nāyake weṣṣäṃ • ñakta|ñäkta āppa|appa ṣañ|ṣäñ śāmna lkālläññempa eneśle ·e /// a4 – ·i reki klyauṣiññe yetwe ste seyi rano aikemar|aikemār pātri paineṣṣe twe(ye) /// a5 (s)nai sklok ñi tane|täne palsko|pälsko • k_uce no • ktsaitstsäññe|ktsaitsäññe • teki • srukalñesa oṃṣap|oṃṣä(p) /// a6 – pepraṅku ramt|ramtä läl(ñ)eṣṣe akālksa|akalksā yärsemār • orocce lāntäśc|lantäścä • /// b1 – – – nāyake añc(a)l(i |ṣärne) yamastär|y(a)m(a)strä w(e)ṣ(ṣ)ä(ṃ) • ñakta|ñäkta āppa|app(a) wināskau-c|w(ināskew-cä) /// b2 eṅkormeṃ weṣṣäṃ • sarvārtthasiddha || putrovātne || #M12# kwri|kr_ui pi wentsi tañ|täñ ; nem(c)e(k) /// %5 #1a %5 ; %4 b3 -ñ , soy lareṃ|lāreṃ #1b patarye|patärye maim|maimä ; yärpallesa|yärpällesā , pälskoṣṣe #1c pīrpe tu postäṃ ; makte|mäkt= āñme /// %4 #1d b4 pataryepi|p(a)täryepi arañcäntse|aräñcäntse yakne kärsau nesau|nese_u tuntse pernesa se auñento s·· /// pataryepi|(patä)|(r)y(e)pi b5 arañcäntse|aräñcäntse yakne|yäkne kärsau nesau|nese_u te weṣṣäṃ mapi|mäpi • yulyka weṣṣäṃ • amāc|amācä • mäk(te) /// b6 ·orsa taṅkw|täṅwä miyäṣṣäṃ • te kärsanat|kärsänatä • yulyka amāc weṣṣäṃ • s(e) ñake|ñäke cwi|cpi reki ne(mcek |ste) ///
a1 Great king, so it will be!
Bibliothèque nationale de France, fonds Pelliot Koutchéen (Paris)

a1 /// ·p· ·s· kl··s·n· _p_as_t_ann· • am·c we_ṣ_ṣ_a· • o··cu w·lo _m_a·t tāk· /// a2 – – wakit_s_aññe rāhuleṃ yaitormeṃ _r_amer ecce _p_k_alar-ne • plaktukiñña weṣṣäṃ • _m_ant tākaṃ – /// a3 – ñäke mcuṣke • nāyake ○ we_ṣ_ṣ_aṃ • ñäkta appa _ṣ_añ śāmna lkā_l_l_aññempa eneśle ·e /// a4 – ·i reki klyauṣiññe yetwe ○ ste seyi rano aikemā_r\• pātri paineṣṣe twe – /// a5 ·nai sklok ñi _t_ane _p_alsko • k_uce no • ktsait_s_aññe • teki • srukalñesa oṃ_ṣ_a – /// a6 – pepraṅku ram_t_a _l_al·eṣṣe akalksā yärsemā_r\• • orocce lan_t_aścä • /// b1 – – – nāyake añc·l· – – y·m·st_r_a w·_ṣ·_a· • ñäkta app· w· /// b2 eṅkormeṃ we_ṣ_ṣ_aṃ • sarvārtthasiddha || putrovātne || kr_ui pi wentsi _t_añ\ nem·e /// b3 -ñ soy lāreṃ pa_t_arye mai_m_a yä○rpällesā _p_alskoṣṣe pīrpe tu pos_t_aṃ _m_akt= āñme /// b4 p·_t_aryepi a_r_añcäntse yakne _k_arsau nese_u\• tuntse pernesa se auñento s·· /// b5 ·y·pi a_r_añcäntse yäkne _k_arsau nese_u\• te we_ṣ_ṣ_aṃ _m_api • yulyka we_ṣ_ṣ_aṃ • amācä • _m_ak· /// b6 ·orsa _t_aṅwä miyä_ṣ_ṣ_aṃ • te _k_ar_s_ana_t_a • yulyka amāc we_ṣ_ṣ_aṃ • s· ñäke cpi reki ne ///

div.p:
I have entered a very preliminary transliteration based on the transcription and the photograph in order to test the XML conversion scripts. It should be revised while marking up the akṣaras in Transkribus. (BK)

Alternative classifications:

please do not cite without asking Michaël Peyrot or Georges-Jean Pinault

  • What did b5 "m̱a̱pi" mean!? Taken as "_m_api" and therefore changed to "mäpi". –Martin (Fri, 2014-10-17, 10:41:55)

"~" changed to "•". Presumably this was meant? "~" to indicate a "•" that is stretched or dragged on to the next akṣara?? (cf. lines a2, a3) - BK, TI
